intro: Euonymus poilanei, commonly known as the creeping euonymus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cercidifolium. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by bright red, spherical fruits that are visually striking. Euonymus poilanei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and ground covers.
